pageContext.description: It lay on a thin hard bed of black substance, which is thought to have been a hearth.  One flange on each face is bent inwards, one of these is slightly chipped.
pageContext.patina: Yellowish green, rubbed off in places
pageContext.surface: Pitted, probably rough casting.  Small hole on one face of blade, probably the result of faulty casting.  On the same side is a pick mark made by the finder.
pageContext.publications: Train. [sic] Lanc. & Chesh. Antiq. Soc. XXIX. 222, 2 plates,  Hist. Soc. of Lancs. & Chesh., N.S. XXVIII, 287, 1 plate
pageContext.collection: Wallasey Public Library,  Lent by J. Kitchingman, Esq.,  1957 (Note from Chester Museum) untraceable and presumed returned to owner
pageContext.site: England, Cheshire, Wallasey, Liscard, Zig Zag Road
pageContext.remarks: 3 ft. deep, found in digging a drain, Sept. 1901, by Edward Ledson, Egerton Grove, Liscard.
